definition: the act of jumping, go back and forth
details:
noun
- the act of jumping
= synonyms: jumping
- descent with a parachute
= synonyms: parachuting
- a sudden involuntary movement
= synonyms: start, startle
- (film) an abrupt transition from one scene to another
- an abrupt transition
= synonyms: saltation
- a sudden and decisive increase
= example: a sudden and decisive increase
= synonyms: leap
verb
- go back and forth
= synonyms: alternate
- rise in rank or status
= example: rise in rank or status
= synonyms: rise, climb up
- increase suddenly and significantly
= example: increase suddenly and significantly
- pass abruptly from one state or topic to another
= synonyms: leap
- bypass
= synonyms: skip
- enter eagerly into
= example: enter eagerly into
- make a sudden physical attack on
= example: make a sudden physical attack on
- start (a car engine whose battery is dead) by connecting it to another car's battery
= synonyms: jump-start
- move or jump suddenly, as if in surprise or alarm
= synonyms: start, startle
- move forward by leaps and bounds
= synonyms: spring
- cause to jump or leap
= example: cause to jump or leap
= synonyms: leap
- jump from an airplane and descend with a parachute
= synonyms: chute, parachute
- run off or leave the rails
= synonyms: derail
- jump down from an elevated point
= example: jump down from an elevated point
= synonyms: leap
- be highly noticeable
= synonyms: stick out, stand out, leap out, jump out
